name: Mixed Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [D] | 10 Questions

questions.text: With which city is the novelist Peter Ackroyd associated?
questions.explanation:
London.

	London - most of his novels are set in London and he has also written a best-selling history called 'London, the Biography'.

questions.text: What of the following is NOT an ingredient of glass?
questions.explanation:
Tannic acid.

	Glass is primarily made of sand, soda ash, pot ash, zinc, and bone ash, plus additives to give colour. Tannic acid is used in making ink.

questions.text: Which art movement included Matisse and Dufy?
questions.explanation:
Fauvism.

	Dufy and Matisse were Fauvistes, a French C19th art movement contemporary with impressionism. Expressionism and Cubism were C20th century movements. Fauvism (linked to the French word 'fauve' for an untamed creature) is brightly coloured, naive and post-impressionist in style.

questions.text: The inventor of the lightbulb was Thomas Edison: what was his middle name?
questions.explanation:
Alva.

	Alva, which means 'sublime', rather appropriate.

questions.text: In what culture is Papa the mother?
questions.explanation:
Maori.

	In the Maori culture of New Zealand, the Earth Mother is called 'Papa'.

questions.text: Where in the UK is the 'Lake District'?
questions.explanation:
Cumbria.

	The Lake District is in Cumbria, NW England. Famous places there include Ambleside, Windermere and Derwentwater, with literary associations with Wordsworth and Beatrix Potter.

questions.text: What is the capital of Pakistan?
questions.explanation:
Islamabad.

	Islamabad is the federal capital of Pakistan. Karachi and Lahore are Pakistan's other main cities. Dhaka is the capital of Bangladesh.

questions.text: For what film did Olympia Dukakis win an 'Oscar'?
questions.explanation:
Moonstruck.

	'Moonstruck' in which she played Cher's Italian mother.

questions.text: The 2002 association football world cup is to be held in two countries, can you name either?
questions.explanation:
Japan & Korea & South Korea.

	The World Cup will be hosted by both Japan and Korea with matches in cities including Sapporo, Osaka and Seoul.

questions.text: Vietnam is a major coffee exporter: true or false?
questions.explanation:
True & t & Yes & y.

	True - Vietnam exports more coffee than Colombia and is second only to Brazil.
